User Interfaces
Prev Chapter 1. Introduction to GMAT Next

User Interfaces

GMAT has several user interfaces. The graphical user interface is an interactive GUI and is introduced in more detail in later sections. The script interface is textual and also allows the user to set up and execute all aspects of GMAT. The MATLAB interface is a secondary textual interface for running the system via calls from MATLAB to GMAT and allows GMAT to call MATLAB functions from within the GMAT command sequence. An interface currently under development is a C language API for low level calls into the GMAT engine.
